file_content.text: Thanks to you, the cover for our contact inside House Ulgo is secure.
I found the spikes. Your man in Ulgo is safe.
Nice work. I had a hunch you wouldn't let me down.
It's good to know the Republic has someone like you on our side.
Retrieve the spikes from the Killik warrens and bring them back to me.
Agent Essor. Republic SIS.
Always a pleasure to meet a guardian of the Republic. Especially since I've got a problem that could use a Jedi's touch.
Always a pleasure to meet a member of the Republic's fine fighting troops. Especially since I've got a problem that could use a soldier's touch.
I've seen the SIS files on you. You've done a fair bit of work for the Republic. That's good, because I could really use some help right now.
The SIS spent months getting one of our agents deep inside House Ulgo. If we don't act fast, the whole operation could end in disaster.
What went wrong?
What's the name of your contact inside House Ulgo?
Who's the agent?
Kamen Proy. One of our top agents. We'd hate to lose him over something like this.
You're not prepared for this?
We have contingency plans for all the typical scenarios. But we didn't expect anything like this.
A messenger was transporting prototype computer spikes to our contact--SIS technology designed to decrypt and upload enemy data, highly secret and highly advanced.
The Killiks caught our messenger and dragged him off into their warrens, along with the spikes. If they fall into the wrong hands, our agent's in danger--if not the whole SIS.
All you seem to care about is what happened to those spikes.
What about the messenger?
I'm just being realistic. The messenger's dead; there's nothing we can do for him.
Nobody's going to find it.
Nobody's going to find it.
You said it yourself--the spikes are buried somewhere deep inside the Killik warrens. They're not going to turn up anytime soon.
Nobody's going to find it.
The SIS doesn't like to leave loose ends. They have a way of making things unravel.
Anyone who finds those spikes will know the SIS is operating here--worse, they'll have a technology that's supposed to be top secret.
This tragic situation could become a galactic incident. If you can locate those spikes in the Killik nest, I'll be here.
Pass. [Refuse quest]
Then get on your way and I'll try to find someone who can help me.
I don't want to talk right now.
